meanings.definition: To execute by means of a guillotine.
meanings.sent1: The criminal was guillotining for his crimes.
meanings.sent2: The executioner was guillotining the condemned prisoner.
meanings.sent3: The guillotining of the cake at the party was a unique way to celebrate.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to guillotine unnecessary expenses to improve profits.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the guillotine guillotining echoed through the square.

meanings.definition: To cut off with a guillotine.
meanings.sent1: The chef was guillotining vegetables for the soup.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was guillotining the fabric to make precise cuts.
meanings.sent3: The barber jokingly threatened to guillotine the unruly hair.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter winds seemed to guillotine the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The guillotining of the rope was necessary to free the trapped animal.
